Comment: Unethical AF if it's not double-blind.  You don't just give a group of people a placebo and see if that improves herd immunity.  My understanding is that he either A: Doesn't think we already do double-blind experiments, or B:  Wants studies exclusively on the placebo effect of a population for a particular condition,  before investing in vaccine research in the first place.  If the placebo effect is significant,  the vaccine research isn't important.     Basically No Child Left Behind, using the placebo effect as the testing metric for vaccine prioritization and funding/research allocation

But RFK is probably going to consider each update as a "new vaccine" and thus kind of render them ineffective

Author: 2a_lib

Comment: This is specifically to target improvements to drugs, mainly seasonal vaccines. For novel drugs or drugs meant to treat conditions for which we have no other treatments, we do test against placebo. For things like improving insulin, vaccines, or testing new drugs that treat a condition for which we already have treatments available, we test them against the current standard of care. If you want to introduce a drug, you have to demonstrate that it is either better or equivalent to the options we have available. If you want to make a new form of insulin, you need to show that your new formula meets or exceeds the current treatment available.  This new testing process is redundant for novel/lone treatments. It is absurd for regularly updated treatments, since it's treating a drug that undergoes slight modification as a new drug. Do not misunderstand, this is an attempt to rebrand covid, flu, and other vaccines as not tested to his bullshit standard and force their makers to stop making them.
